text: The rise of autonomous vehicles has ushered in a transformative era in transportation, revolutionizing mobility through cutting-edge technologies. Key to this transformation is the integration of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and learning algorithms, which have propelled vehicles into realms of unprecedented autonomy. This paper undertakes a comprehensive exploration of AI's evolutionary trajectory within autonomous vehicles, mapping its journey from foundational principles to recent advancements. Beginning with an overview of the current landscape, the paper delves into AI's crucial role in shaping vehicles' autonomous decision-making capabilities. It also addresses ethical considerations and bias in AI-driven software development for autonomous vehicles. The study provides statistical insights into the usage and types of AI/learning algorithms, showcasing the evolving research landscape in the automotive industry. Moreover, the paper emphasizes the pivotal role of parameters in refining algorithms for both trucks and cars, enabling vehicles to adapt, learn, and enhance performance over time. It concludes by outlining different levels of autonomy and discussing the variation in software package sizes across various autonomy levels.
name: new-040
